definition: hole/opening/cut/gap/gash/my husband or wife/classifier for people (used for indicating the number of people in a family etc)/precedent
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
a dike breaks/fig. to provide facilities (for evil deeds)/to open the floodgates

sentences.english: Have you sewn up the tear in my coat?
sentences.chinese: 你把我大衣上那個撕破的口子縫起來了嗎？

sentences.english: The day the second child was born, their migrant-worker days were over.
sentences.chinese: 從生老二那天起，兩口子的打工生活就結束了。

sentences.english: There’s a rip in my luggage.
sentences.chinese: 我的行李被撕了道口子。

sentences.english: Second aunt couple are Medical, division-level cadres after the treatment of retirement.
sentences.chinese: 二姨兩口子都是軍醫，後以師級幹部待遇退休。

sentences.english: I had a gash like a long slug, just behind my ear.
sentences.chinese: 我的耳朵後面劃了個口子，血流出了長長一溜。

sentences.english: Since then, the pair have avoided the media.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後，兩口子一直迴避着新聞媒體。

sentences.english: He gashed his arm on a piece of broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 他的胳膊被玻璃碎片劃了一個大口子。

sentences.english: A hole was torn in your jacket. Let me stitch up the torn jacket for you.
sentences.chinese: 你的上衣撕了個口子，我給你縫縫吧。

sentences.english: He got a 6 inch gash in his foot from a trim nail I didn't pick up.
sentences.chinese: 一隻漏下的釘子給他的腳上來了道6英寸長的口子。

sentences.english: The pair, from Sydney, Australia, have conquered some of the world's highest peaks.
sentences.chinese: 兩口子來自澳洲悉尼，已經征服了不少世界高峯。

sentences.english: A husband and his wife had a bitter quarrel on the day of their 40th wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 有兩口子，在結婚40週年紀念日那天大吵一架。

sentences.english: I am is, sister-in-law's couple was all also affectionate, forgot this gift sons.
sentences.chinese: 我當是，弟妹兩口子太過恩愛，把這禮兒都忘了。

sentences.english: Upon seeing the tear in the painting I shed a tear.
sentences.chinese: 看到油畫被撕開一個口子，我哭了。

sentences.english: He clawed a hole in my shirt in his temper.
sentences.chinese: 他一氣之下把我的襯衫撕了一個口子。

sentences.english: LinZhenHai cannot enter the lim, but hide in cut bay.
sentences.chinese: 林振海無法進入了老林，但是躲在了口子灣。

definition: bloody mouth (from devouring freshly killed prey)
a dike breaks/fig. to provide facilities (for evil deeds)/to open the floodgates
tear or rupture/to have a tear (e.g. in one's clothes)/without restraint (e.g. of swearing)
to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
